sen.j: 御称号（ごしょうごう）とは、日本の皇族に与えられる称号。
sen.e: Goshogo is a title given to an Imperial family in Japan.
Goshogo is a title given to an Imperial family in Japan.

sen.j: 日本の皇族の幼少時に与えられる称号で、現在は天皇の子女及び皇太子の子女に対して与えられ、宮家の子女には与えられない。
sen.e: Goshogo is a title given to a member of the Imperial family in Japan when he or she is young, and presently it is given to Emperor's children and Crown Prince's children but not to children of Miyake (families allowed to have the status of Imperial family).

sen.j: 基本的には漢字一文字と「宮」の組み合わせである。
sen.e: Basically it is the combination of one kanj (Chinese character) and the character 'miya'.
Basically it is the combination of one kanji (Chinese character) and the character '宮/Miya' (Imperial prince/princes).
sen.cmt: ・誤記訂正kanj→kanji・修正'miya'→'宮/Miya' (Imperial prince/princes)漢字そのものが主題となるとみなして、「宮」を挿入
sen.e: Basically it is the combination of one kanji (Chinese character) and the character '宮/Miya' (Imperial prince/princes).

sen.j: 漢字の出典については、五経などの古典から学者が選出し、天皇にいくつかの案を提出し、天皇が案から選んで与えることになっている。
sen.e: For the source of the kanji, scholars make selection from classical books such as Gokyo (the Five Classics texts of Confucianism) and submit several proposals to the Emperor from which he chooses it and gives it to the recipient.

sen.j: 現在の皇太子である徳仁親王の長女・愛子内親王の御称号（及び名）は、皇太子夫妻の意向を汲んで天皇が選んだとされている。
sen.e: The Goshogo (and name) of Imperial Prince Naruhito, the oldest daughter of Imperial Prince Naruhito who is the present Crown Prince is said to have been chosen by the Emperor by taking into consideration of the wish of the Crown Prince and Princess.

The Goshogo (and the name) of Imperial Princess Aiko, the oldest daughter of Imperial Prince Naruhito who is the present Crown Prince, is said to have been chosen by the Emperor by taking into consideration of the wish of the Crown Prince and Princess.

sen.e: The Goshogo (and the name) of Imperial Princess Aiko, the oldest daughter of Imperial Prince Naruhito who is the present Crown Prince, is said to have been chosen by the Emperor by taking into consideration of the wish of the Crown Prince and Princess.

sen.e: It is unknown when this custom was started, but it seems that it had already been fixed in the Edo period.
